description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} having k blocks of length 2 (0 <= k <= floor(n/2)). A block of a permutation is a maximal sequence of consecutive integers which appear in consecutive positions. For example, the permutation 5412367 has 4 blocks: 5, 4, 123, and 67; one of them is of length 2.
